byline.contributor: Suliman Alzway contributed reporting from Misurata.

abstract: Small group of fighters from Misurata, Libya, vanguard of force attacking Col Muammar el-Qaddafi's former hometown and final hide-out, are first to find him and keep as souvenirs his last prized possessions; Misurata suffered under long siege by Qaddafi's troops and responded with rage, sending fighters to capture Tripoli and later Surt; bodies of Qaddafi and his son Muatassim on display strike many residents as fitting end.
snippet: Fighters from Misurata were the first to find Colonel Qaddafi and kept as souvenirs his last prized possessions.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: Fighters from Misurata were the first to find Colonel Qaddafi and kept as souvenirs his last prized possessions.

headline.main: After Making Capture in Pipe, Displaying the Trophies of War
headline.print_headline: After Making Capture in Pipe, Displaying the Trophies of War
